intro: Tanacetum larvatum, commonly known as the lesser tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are usually hairy as well. Tanacetum larvatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
